issues.title: Public health impact not clearly articulated
issues.message: The significance section lacks concrete statistics on disease burden and public health impact.
issues.original_text: This disease affects many people and causes substantial morbidity.
issues.suggested_rewrite: This disease affects approximately 2.5 million Americans annually, resulting in over $15 billion in healthcare costs and 50,000 preventable deaths per year (CDC, 2023).
issues.rationale: Reviewers expect quantitative data on disease burden. Vague statements about 'many people' and 'substantial morbidity' weaken the significance argument.

issues.title: Innovation claims not differentiated from existing approaches
issues.message: The proposal does not clearly explain how this approach differs from or improves upon existing methods.
issues.original_text: Our approach uses machine learning to analyze patient data. This will improve treatment outcomes.
issues.suggested_rewrite: Unlike existing rule-based systems that analyze only 3-5 clinical variables, our deep learning approach integrates 150+ multi-modal features including genomic, proteomic, and imaging data, achieving 40% better predictive accuracy in preliminary studies.
issues.rationale: Innovation sections must explicitly contrast with current state-of-the-art. Generic claims about 'using machine learning' are insufficient.

issues.title: Power analysis missing for Aim 2
issues.message: Sample size justification lacks statistical power calculations for the primary outcome in Aim 2.
issues.original_text: We will recruit 100 patients for the validation study.
issues.suggested_rewrite: Based on pilot data showing an effect size of 0.35, we will recruit 100 patients to achieve 80% power to detect a 25% improvement in the primary outcome (Î±=0.05, two-tailed), accounting for 15% attrition.
issues.rationale: NIH reviewers expect formal power calculations. Arbitrary sample sizes suggest inadequate statistical planning.

issues.title: Recruitment timeline appears optimistic
issues.message: The proposed recruitment of 100 rare disease patients in 6 months seems unrealistic without established infrastructure.
issues.original_text: Patient recruitment will be completed within 6 months.
issues.suggested_rewrite: Patient recruitment will leverage our established rare disease registry (n=450) and three clinical sites, with staggered enrollment over 12 months to account for seasonal variation and ensure adequate screening.
issues.rationale: Realistic timelines with contingency planning demonstrate feasibility. Consider extending recruitment period or documenting existing patient pools.

issues.title: Alternative approaches not discussed
issues.message: The proposal lacks discussion of alternative strategies if the primary approach fails.
issues.rationale: Strong proposals include alternative approaches and decision points. Consider adding a brief section on backup strategies for high-risk aims.

issues.title: Knowledge gap not explicitly stated
issues.message: The specific knowledge gap this research addresses is implied but not clearly articulated.
issues.original_text: More research is needed in this area to improve patient outcomes.
issues.suggested_rewrite: The critical knowledge gap is the lack of understanding of how genetic variants in the XYZ pathway influence drug metabolism in pediatric populations, preventing personalized dosing strategies.
issues.rationale: Explicitly stating 'The knowledge gap is...' helps reviewers quickly identify the study's contribution to the field.

significance.label: Significance Review
significance.summary: The proposal addresses an important health problem but needs stronger articulation of public health impact with concrete statistics. The knowledge gap should be more explicitly defined to justify the research investment.
major_strengths: Addresses a clearly important disease area

innovation.label: Innovation Review
innovation.summary: The innovative aspects of this proposal are not well differentiated from existing approaches. While machine learning is mentioned, the specific advances beyond current methods need clearer articulation.
major_concerns: Innovation not clearly distinguished from existing work
No discussion of why previous approaches failed

approach_rigor.label: Approach & Rigor
approach_rigor.summary: The experimental design shows promise but lacks critical methodological details. Power analysis is missing for Aim 2, and alternative approaches are not discussed. Statistical planning needs strengthening throughout.
major_concerns: Missing power calculations for primary outcomes

feasibility.label: Feasibility & Team Fit
feasibility.summary: The team has appropriate expertise but the timeline appears optimistic, particularly for recruitment. The 6-month recruitment window for rare disease patients needs justification or revision.
major_concerns: Recruitment timeline unrealistic without documented patient pool
